content.question: A right triangle has base <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> feet and height <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></math> feet, where <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></math> is constant and <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> changes with respect to time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, measured in seconds. The angle <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, measured in radians, is defined by <math alttext="tangent theta, equals, h over x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following best describes the relationship between <math alttext="the derivative of theta, with respect to t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, the rate of change of <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow></math> with respect to time, and <math alttext="the derivative of h, with respect to t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, the rate of change of <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> with respect to time?

choices.label: <math alttext="the derivative of theta, with respect to t, equals, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator x, and denominator x squared, plus h squared, end fraction, close parenthesis, times the derivative of h, with respect to t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> radians per second

<math alttext="the derivative of theta, with respect to t, equals, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator x squared, and denominator x squared, plus h squared, end fraction, close parenthesis, times the derivative of h, with respect to t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> radians per second

<math alttext="the derivative of theta, with respect to t, equals, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator the square root of x squared, plus h squared, end root, end fraction, close parenthesis, times the derivative of h, with respect to t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> radians per second

<math alttext="the derivative of theta, with respect to t, equals, the inverse tangent of, open parenthesis, 1 over x, times the derivative of h, with respect to t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mrow><msup><mi>tan</mi><mn>-1</mn></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> radians per second

content.answer: <math alttext="the derivative of theta, with respect to t, equals, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator x, and denominator x squared, plus h squared, end fraction, close parenthesis, times the derivative of h, with respect to t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> radians per second

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
